intro: Pilocarpus goudotianus, commonly known as the wild jatoba or Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically consumed by various wildlife species. It is also valued for its medicinal properties, particularly for its use in treating eye conditions and as a stimulant. Its ability to thrive in humid, tropical environments makes it an important component of the rainforest ecosystem.
